snippet: Ahead of the release of the Osama bin Laden manhunt thriller, “Zero Dark Thirty,” critics are divided over the film’s suggestion that the infliction of pain may have produced useful clues to find the terrorist leader.
abstract: Ahead of the release of the Osama bin Laden manhunt thriller, “Zero Dark Thirty,” critics are divided over the film’s suggestion that the infliction of pain may have produced useful clues to find the terrorist leader.
lead_paragraph: Ahead of the release of the Osama bin Laden manhunt thriller, “Zero Dark Thirty,” critics, journalists and activists are divided over the film’s suggestion that the infliction of pain may have produced useful clues to find the terrorist leader, who was killed in May 2011.

headline.main: Portrayal of C.I.A Torture in Bin Laden Film Renews Debate
